page.title: 12Arbroath, Mary Mitchell.
page.content: Mary, who used to be both pupil and cleaner,at our school came to talk of the changes she had seen. She came in 1911 aged five.At this time there were coal fires,paraffin lamps,the desks were in tiers and lessons were written on a slate We were very interested to hear about 'school dinners',when Mary came back to work at the school.One of the outbuildings was the soup kitchen.Mary had to light the fire to heat the soup ,and water to wash the dishes . The soup was carried into the school in buckets and the children ate it at their desks.It cost one old penny for as much as you wanted! Every morning at 7 a.m. she had to stoke up the fires.Each month about two tons of anthracite was delivered so you can see how hard she had to work!
